title: Gayong88
author: Gayong88
content: The fight between Bitcoin and Ethereum dominance is very interesting to follow and we all know Bitcoin has always dominated the cryptocurrency market and for now it looks like Ethereum is getting closer to Bitcoin and Ethereum Supply will deflation decrease -2% a year after The Merge proof of stake later. Will a new king of the cryptocurrency market willcome?

comments.author: passwordnow

There's no fight between the dominance of these two. Bitcoin will always have the highest dominance then next is Ethereum.Quote from: Gayong88 on June 21, 2022, 04:51:28 AMWill a new king of the cryptocurrency market willcome?No. It has been asked for so many times for the past years and there will be no new king in the market. But bitcoin will remain as the king of the crypto market.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Dominances of Bitcoin and Ethereum nowadays are not correctly reflect the market like they were in the past.Do you know why? Each year more altcoin projects created. Each bull market, we have hundreds or thousands of new altcoin projects. They can have no real value but at some times, they contribute to total market cap of the crypto market. The dominances of Bitcoin and Ethereum will be more accurate in bottom of bear market when most of no-value altcoin projects down and their caps fall to very low figures or even to zero.

comments.body: Bitcoin as the first cryptocurrency has advantages over other cryptocurrency technologies. comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Well, it is very hard to call it a struggle, because the difference between the capitalization of Bitcoin and Ethereum is 3 times. I don't think there will be a shift of the cryptocurrency leader, bitcoin is the #1 cryptocurrency for everyone and it is much more popular in terms of investing and cooperating with businesses from the world of traditional finance, such as funds, banking institutions and so on. Ethereum will still be the leader of its segment, in the field of smart contracts, but it is not enough to displace bitcoin from its position. In addition, the move to PoS will make it a less trusted asset because PoS is more centralized than PoW.

comments.author: Gayong88
comments.body: Quote from: poodle63 on June 21, 2022, 10:32:47 PMMaybe someday ETH could overtake BTC thrones but then again the dominance of BTC could always increase so fast.Bitcoin's price has been increasing recently, but still not enough to cover the cost of mining a single coin. In fact, it has been reported that some miners have been losing money. If Ethereum continues to rise in price, large mining pools will switch back to mining Ether over Bitcoin. BTC prices could stagnate as more miners turn back to ETH. If this occurs, ETH might overtake BTC in market cap and become king. I also thought, maybe it's just a matter of time.
